summary: This bill, the IDEA Full Funding Act (S. 1277), aims to fully fund Part B of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).  It proposes increasing federal funding for special education over the coming years, guaranteeing a specified percentage of funds based on the number of students with disabilities and the national average per-pupil expenditure.  The bill specifies appropriation amounts for fiscal years 2026 through 2035 and beyond, outlining when the funds become available and for how long. It gradually increases funding to reach 40% of the calculated amount or the specified dollar amount provided each year.
